title: Strategic purchasing plan canned fruit product category of Kraft Heinz company in Australia and New Zealand
abstract: To strive as being the leader in the food and beverages industry, Kraft Heinz Company has been continuously improving its efficiency to optimize its operations and to maximize its profitability. This research focuses on the role of global procurement co-pack department, which deals with the buying of finished goods from external contract manufacturers. Currently, the sourcing process of canned fruit products in Australia and New Zealand is being done ad-hoc. This brings an opportunity to do a research on what is the best sourcing strategy for this product category in order to minimize cost savings gap and to bring both financial and operational benefits for the company. With the research and analysis from company's internal archival data, interviews, and desk researches, it show that the company should leverage competition among suppliers by the tendering method.
source: Undergraduate Thesis No. 34010312/MAN/2017; Tania Aveline Tanujaya (34413026)
